result.execSummary:
The defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Burglarious Tools [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.12.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments.  Bail to apply.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 13CF2152, consecutive to any other time being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment, or full time school and part time employment.

No drug dealing or association with drug community, drug users, dealers or drug houses.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Participate in cognitive thinking program.
Pay all supervision fees.
Obtain AODA asssessment.  If necessary, successfully complete follow up treatment.  Cooperate with random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Pursuant to  Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restriction: firearm possession and voting.
**The Court suggest the defendant seek vocational training through the Department of Corrections.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Casimier Lebronze Wright

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Packet.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Sentencing Hearing.  The Court is unable to hear this matter on today due to the lateness of the hour.  New date selected with the parties.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

TURN OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision/Electronic Monitoring and ALL OTHER PREVIOUSLY ORDERED TERMS AND CONDITIONS REMAIN.

*$750.00 cash on deposit/defendant needs to post $250.00 CASH*

Defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Jeremy R. Arn for Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

*CASE HEARD WITHOUT CIRCUIT COURT FILE*  Matter before the Court on walk-in basis to address JusticePoint violation report.  Parties in receipt of report.  Statements made by the state and defense.  State's motion for remand denied by the Court.  The Court orders bail increased by $250.00 with turn over to Justice Point (same terms and conditions).  Case remains set for Sentencing Hearing on 2-04-15 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 21.
Justice Point VIOLATION REPORT (drug test violation/refusal), received and filed.

15RM001824  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01-15-2015

TURN OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring AND ALL OTHER PREVIOUSLY ORDERED TERMS AND CONDITIONS REMAIN.

*$500.00 posted on 11-21-14/defendant needs to post $250.00 CASH*

Defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Calendar call.  Hearing proceeded.  Parties in receipt of multiple Justice Point violation reports.  Bail arguments made by the state and defense.  State's motion for remand denied by the Court.  The Court orders bail increased by $250.00 with turn over to electronic monitoring and all other terms and conditions continued.  Case remains set for Sentencing Hearing on 2-04-15 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 21.
JusticePoint VIOLATION REPORT (gps violation on 1-12-15), received and filed.
JusticePoint VIOLATION REPORT (violation from 1-7-15 to 1-08-15), received and filed.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin telephonically (charging week).  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court on walk-in basis to address JusticePoint violation reports.  Parties in receipt of 3 reports filed while the court was not in session.  Statements made by the state and defense.  State requests bench warrant.  Defense requests stay of warrant.  The Court orders Bench warrant to issue but stayed.  Case set for Calendar Call/bail/bond hearing on 1-12-15 at 1:30 p.m. before Branch 21.
JusticePoint report (gps violation on 1-01-15- battery), received and filed.
JusticePoint report (GPS violation on 1-06-15- zone violation), received and filed.
JusticePoint VIOLATION REPORT (drug test refusal on 12-15-14), filed.
Defendant motion for modification of bail heard.  Court GRANTS motion to modify Justice Point GPS monitoring to allow for release Monday - Friday from 12:00 pm to 5:00 p.m.

Defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Matter adjourned for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Amended Information received and filed.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.

14RM052463  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
11-21-14

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Defense still in a contest posture.  Parties prepared to proceed to trial.  Case remains set for Jury Trial before Branch 21 on 12-15-14 at 9:00 a.m.
filed.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Defense in a contest posture.  Parties advised that any and all motions must be filed in Br. 21 on or before the final pretrial date; hearing to be scheduled at the time of filing.  Motions must be heard prior to trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright not in court, in custody.  Megan Carmody for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Attorney Detert appears as successor counsel.  Attorney Detert provided discover on today by Attorney Yasin.  Defense needs time to review said materials.  Status conference scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Release for employment (subject to verification), attorney contacts, and court appearances ONLY. 

*ALL OTHER PREVIOUSLY ORDERED CONDITIONS OF BAIL CONTINUED*

Defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright in court with attorney Awni M. Yasin.  Defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Final pretrial/Projected guilty plea.  Motion to withdraw filed by defense on today.  Statements of defense and defendant heard.  Speedy trial demand addressed with the defendant.   Based upon defendant's desire for new counsel the defendant wishes to withdraw speedy trial demand at this time.  State makes motion to address bail prior to court ruling on defense motion to withdraw.  Bail arguments heard.  The Court modifys bail to include tot Justice Point for electronic monitoring.  All other previously ordered bail conditions remain.  Court grants defense motion and vacates jury trial date of 8-04-14.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Final pretrial held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Joint request for additional final pretrial/possible guilty plea date prior to jury trial date granted.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Speedy trial demand by defendant.

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.   Defense in a contest posture and enters DEMAND FOR SPEEDY TRIAL.   Parties advised that any and all motions must be filed in Br. 21 on or before the final pretrial date; hearing to be scheduled at the time of filing.  Motions must be heard prior to trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Awni M Yasin appears via telephone, defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright not in court, in custody(produced).  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Attorney Yasin unable to appear for today's hearing.  Defense request for short adjournment granted.
  Status conference scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright in court with Attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter before the Court for Motion Hearing.  Defense motion argued and granted by the court.  Jury trial date of 6-04-14 vacated at this time.  On motion of the state, the Court orders "keep separate" from co-actor Lenard Daniel.    Attorney Johnson to notify the public defenders office of the need for appointment of new counsel.  Status conference scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter set for Motion Hearing.   Branch 21 in jury trial in an unrelated matter, defense request for adjournment granted.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter before the Court for Motion Hearing.  Defendant not produced from the House of Corrections; motion hearing rescheduled.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
dated 4-23-14 from the defendant requesting new counsel, received and filed.
Notice of Motion for a New Lawyer, signed and filed.

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright not in court, in custody and not produced.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Final pre-trial conference held off the record. Case remains calendared for jury trial on June 4, 2014 at 9:00 a.m., Branch 21.
from Attorney Richard Johnson, received and filed.

Attorney Richard J. Johnson in court, defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Defense in constest posture at this time and requests jury trial.  Defendant has vop hold in an unrelated matter.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing FEBRUARY 24, 2014 received and filed. (13 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Richard Johnson - SPD  819 N 6th Street  9th Floor  Milwaukee, WI  53203.
Speedy trial demand. (REQUEST WAS MADE AFTER DATE WAS PREVIOUSLY SELECTED BY ATTORNEY JOHNSON AND CO-DEFENDANT COUNSEL.)

Defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Scott Iverson-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Casimier Lebronze Wright in custody.  Brittany C. Grayson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
